name: Deus Brut Des Flandres
overview_description: Fruity, slightly sour taste with sweetness and clear character of apples, hints of honey and bitter orange. Served at 6-8°C as a companion drink, or with not too sweet fruit and berry desserts.

taste_description.scent: Malty aroma with hints of rye bread, crackers, orange marmalade, spices and dried fruit.
taste_description.flavor: Malty taste with hints of rye bread, crackling, orange peel, spices and dried fruit.

servingTips: Served at 6-8°C as a companion drink, or with not too sweet fruit and berry desserts.

about.brewery: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Cras aliquam turpis nec accumsan imperdiet. Curabitur rutrum facilisis ultricies. Sed feugiat auctor neque non porta. reviews.name: Hanna Snarberg
reviews.text: I really recommend this beer. It is quite similar to Rocheford 10. Will definitely order it again.

reviews.name: Alfred Knowles
reviews.text: I had this beer with goat cheese as suggested and I highly recommend.

reviews.name: Filip Mattsson
reviews.text: Similar in taste to Gueuzerie. But this was even better. It was amazing actually.

reviews.name: Mervan Kaya
reviews.text: All my friends and I loved this beer. Perfect for a chill night.

name: Grand Cru 2023
overview_description: Grand Cru 2023 offers a luxurious and bold flavor profile, perfect for those who appreciate the depth and complexity of dark ales. Its 10.2% ABV is well-integrated, providing a warming sensation that complements the beer’s rich maltiness.

taste_description.scent: Aromas of dark chocolate, toffee, and a hint of dark fruits such as plums and raisins.
taste_description.flavor: A rich and robust flavor profile with notes of caramelized malts, dark chocolate, and a subtle sweetness that balances the beer’s full body.
taste_description.color: A deep, dark brown hue with a tan head that lingers.

servingTips: Best enjoyed at a slightly warmer temperature, around 10-12°C, to fully appreciate the depth of its flavors.

about.brewery: Vreta Kloster Bryggeri, nestled in the heart of Sweden, is renowned for its commitment to quality and its passion for crafting exceptional beers that stand the test of time.

reviews.name: Emma Larsson
reviews.text: Grand Cru 2023 blew me away with its rich flavors and smooth finish. It’s like a symphony of dark chocolate and caramel in every sip. Absolutely divine!

reviews.name: Gustav Svensson
reviews.text: This is by far one of the best dark ales I've ever had. The complexity and depth of flavors are outstanding. A must-try for any beer aficionado.

reviews.name: Isabella Johansson
reviews.text: I really enjoyed the Grand Cru 2023, especially the notes of dark chocolate and toffee. It paired wonderfully with a blue cheese platter we had.

reviews.name: Oscar Nilsson
reviews.text: A robust and flavorful beer, perfect for sipping on a cold evening. The malty sweetness is well-balanced, making it a great choice for those new to dark ales.

name: The Holy Grail 2022
overview_description: The Holy Grail 2022 is a masterfully crafted Dark Ale from Vega Bryggeri, showcasing a delightful blend of fruity notes and robust malts. With an 11.3% ABV, it offers a full-bodied experience with a balance that is both intricate and satisfying.

taste_description.scent: A rich bouquet of dark fruits, cherries, and a hint of vanilla, creating a captivating aroma.
taste_description.flavor: Layers of fruity sweetness, balanced by a solid malt backbone, delivering flavors of ripe berries, dark chocolate, and a touch of spice.
taste_description.color: A deep, dark amber color with a resilient beige head.

servingTips: Best enjoyed at a temperature of around 10°C, allowing the complexity of the beer to unfold beautifully.

about.brewery: Vega Bryggeri, situated in Sweden, has earned a reputation for its dedication to the art of brewing, consistently delivering beers that are both complex and enjoyable.

reviews.name: Johanna Karlsson
reviews.text: The Holy Grail 2022 is an exquisite Dark Ale, rich in fruity flavors yet perfectly balanced. A true gem from Vega Bryggeri!

reviews.name: Erik Andersson
reviews.text: With its deep, dark appearance and luscious berry notes, this beer is a standout. It pairs wonderfully with aged cheese.

reviews.name: Sara Lindberg
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by The Holy Grail 2022. The fruity undertones add a unique twist to the traditional Dark Ale, making it a memorable drink.

reviews.name: Daniel Gustafsson
reviews.text: A delightful beer with a rich flavor profile. The berry notes are prominent but well-balanced by the malty sweetness. Highly recommended!

name: Hydra 7 berries
overview_description: Hydra 7 berries is an intricate Sour Ale from Mortalis Brewing Company, intricately crafted to deliver a medley of berry flavors. With a 7% ABV, it offers a tantalizing balance between tartness and sweetness, capturing the essence of seven different berries in every sip.

taste_description.scent: A vibrant burst of mixed berries, with prominent cherry and raspberry notes, and a subtle hint of citrus.
taste_description.flavor: A complex berry blend, dominated by cherry and complemented by layers of raspberry, blackberry, and strawberry, creating a harmonious and tantalizing taste.
taste_description.color: A deep, ruby red hue that promises a berry-packed adventure.

servingTips: Chill well before serving to enhance the refreshing berry flavors. Pairs excellently with desserts or light dishes.

about.brewery: Mortalis Brewing Company, located in the USA, is renowned for its commitment to quality and innovation, consistently producing exceptional and flavor-packed beers.

reviews.name: Emily Turner
reviews.text: Hydra 7 berries has a nice berry punch but is a bit too tart for my liking. It’s refreshing, though, and I can see how others might enjoy it.

reviews.name: Michael Johnson
reviews.text: The berry blend in this beer is fantastic! I love the tartness balanced with the sweetness. It’s a great beer for a hot day.

reviews.name: Rachel Wilson
reviews.text: This is one of my favorite sour ales! The berry flavors are so vibrant and fresh. Highly recommended for anyone who loves fruity beers.

reviews.name: Joshua Brown
reviews.text: Hydra 7 berries is a decent sour ale. The berry flavors are good, but it was a bit sourer than I typically prefer.

name: Bianca Hydra Blueberry Banana Split Lassi Gose
overview_description: A deliciously tart and fruity Sour Ale, Bianca Hydra combines the decadence of a banana split with the tanginess of blueberries, creating a unique and delightful lassi gose experience. Brewed by Omnipollo in collaboration with Mortalis, this beer stands out with its 6% ABV and intricate flavor profile.

taste_description.scent: An aromatic blend of ripe bananas, sweet blueberries, and a hint of tangy yogurt.
taste_description.flavor: A delightful balance of sweetness and tartness, with prominent banana and blueberry notes, followed by a creamy lassi finish.
taste_description.color: A vibrant purple hue, reminiscent of ripe blueberries.

servingTips: Best served chilled to enhance the fruity and tart characteristics. Perfect for dessert or as a refreshing drink on a warm day.

about.brewery: Omnipollo x Mortalis, based in Belgium, is celebrated for its innovative brewing techniques and unique flavor combinations, creating memorable beer experiences.

reviews.name: Sophia Leclerc
reviews.text: The blend of banana and blueberry in this beer is incredible! It’s like a dessert in a can. Absolutely love it!

reviews.name: Liam Verstraete
reviews.text: Never thought I’d enjoy a beer with banana in it, but this one proved me wrong. The balance of flavors is just perfect.

reviews.name: Amelie De Smet
reviews.text: It’s an interesting beer for sure. I liked the fruity notes, but it was a bit too tart for my taste.

reviews.name: Jasper Maes
reviews.text: Bianca Hydra is a unique experience! The combination of blueberry and banana works surprisingly well. A must-try for sour beer lovers.

name: Andromeda
overview_description: Andromeda, a robust stout from the renowned Omnipollo brewery in Sweden, boasts an impressive 15.2% ABV. This beer offers a rich and complex flavor profile that is sure to delight stout lovers.

taste_description.scent: Rich aromas of dark chocolate, roasted malts, and a hint of dark fruit.
taste_description.flavor: Intense flavors of espresso, bitter chocolate, and a touch of sweetness to balance the robustness.
taste_description.color: Deep, dark brown, almost black in color with a tan head.

servingTips: Best served at a slightly warmer temperature, around 12-14°C, to allow the complex flavors to shine.

about.brewery: Omnipollo, based in Sweden, is known for its innovative and high-quality craft beers, consistently delivering unique and enjoyable beer experiences.

reviews.name: Elin Gustafsson
reviews.text: The intensity of this stout is just phenomenal. The chocolate and coffee flavors are so well balanced. A masterpiece!

reviews.name: Axel Lindberg
reviews.text: A very robust and intense stout, but incredibly well crafted. Omnipollo has done it again!

reviews.name: Linnéa Ekström
reviews.text: Andromeda is a beer for those who truly appreciate a rich and bold stout. The flavors are complex and linger on the palate.

reviews.name: Oscar Johansson
reviews.text: This is one of the best stouts I've ever had. The high ABV is well integrated, and the beer is just bursting with flavor.
